info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 4:01AM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from Noon until 8 PM MDT Today for for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 224, and zones 226 through 237, which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado, Fremont county and the San Luis valley (NOTE that the San Luis Valley, Northern El Paso county, and Fremont county have been added to this warning... ...Red Flag Warning has been issued from 11 AM TO 8 PM Tuesday for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 226 through 237 which includes all of the eastern plains of southeast Colorado... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 229... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 229. * Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Timing...Noon until 8 PM MDT Monday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 12 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
